case_vignette:
A 24-year-old woman comes to the physician because of progressively worsening joint pain. She has had diffuse, aching pain in her knees, shoulders, and hands bilaterally for the past few months, but the pain has become much more severe in the past few weeks. She also reports night sweats and generalized malaise. On physical examination, radial and pedal pulses are weak. There are erythematous nodules over the legs that measure 3–5 cm. Laboratory studies show:
Hematocrit 33.2%
Hemoglobin 10.7 g/dL
Leukocyte count 11,300/mm3
Platelet count 615,000/mm3
Erythrocyte sedimentation rate 94 mm/h
Serum
C-reactive protein 40 mg/dL (N=0.08–3.1)
Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?" (From a medical textbook, likely a case study.)
Original text:
A 24-year-old man comes to the physician because of progressively worsening joint pain. He has had diffuse, aching pain in his knees, shoulders, and hands bilaterally for the past few months, but the pain has become much more severe in the past few weeks. He also reports night sweats and generalized malaise. On physical examination, radial and pedal pulses are weak. There are erythematous nodules over the legs that measure 3–5 cm. Laboratory studies show:
Hematocrit 33.2%
Hemoglobin 10.7 g/dL
Leukocyte count 11,300/mm3
Platelet count 615,000/mm3
Erythrocyte sedimentation rate 94 mm/h
Serum
C-reactive protein 40 mg/dL (N=0.08–3.1)
Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

I've been experiencing worsening joint pain in my knees, shoulders, and hands, night sweats, and an overall feeling of being unwell.

I've been having these symptoms for the past few months, but they have gotten much worse over the past few weeks.

Have you noticed any swelling, redness, or warmness around the joints that are in pain?
I haven't noticed swelling or warmth around the joints, but there are red nodules over my legs.

Final Diagnosis: Rheumatoid Arthritis
